data.title: Demon Slayer Season 3 Finale Episode Will be 70 Mins Long
data.meta_description: The final episode of Kimetsu no Yaiba: Demon Slayer Season 3 is nearly here.
data.text:
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Swordsmith Village Arc Final Episode Runtime

The season 3 of the anime will conclude with episode 11, a 70-minute long finale, as announced by the official Twitter account of Demon Slayer on June 11.

Final episode will air on June 18

Titled A Connected Bond: Daybreak and First Light, the final episode of Demon Slayer is scheduled to air on June 18, 2023, marking the end of the season.

First episode was 1-hour long

The season has begun with a special 1-hour episode, setting the stage for the intense and action-packed storyline.

The Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba manga series consists of eleven arcs, with the Swordsmith Village Arc being the ninth in the series.

Previous seasons of the anime have covered multiple arcs, with Season 1 covering the first to sixth arcs and being followed by the film, Demon Slayer the Movie: Mugen Train, which served as the initial part of Season 2.

Season 2 continued with eleven episodes dedicated to the Entertainment District Arc, the eighth arc in the series. While the current season is adapting the arc similarly to previous seasons, it is speculated that the season may finish before getting into the tenth arc of the series.
